summary: Daniel A. Parsons appears to be an individual who compiled notes and memos related to various individuals, organizations, and operations, potentially including those connected to the Penkovsky case. His notes, dated around May 1978, detail the career and assignments of an Air Force officer and his relationships with organizations like the USIA and CIA. The documents suggest Parsons had access to sensitive information and was involved in indexing and file management. One document also mentions the transmittal of sanitized notes to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) concerning individuals like William Alexander Morgan and George de Mohrenschildt, although Parsons' direct involvement in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated.
significance: While the documents indicate Daniel A. Parsons compiled notes related to individuals and organizations potentially relevant to the JFK assassination investigation, his direct role or significance in the assassination itself is not explicitly defined. His notes were provided to the HSCA, suggesting his information was considered relevant to their investigation.
